009
010package imagingbook.common.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.LabColorSpace;
017import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.LuvColorSpace;
018import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.sRgbUtil;
019
020
021// TODO: add JavaDoc, unit tests
022
023/**
024 * This class defines a "color stack" as a subtype of {@link PixelPack}
025 * with exactly 3 components (slices) and all values in [0,1].
026 * It allows simple conversion between various colorimetric color 
027 * spaces (currently implemented are sRGB, LinearRGB, CIELab and CIELuv).
028 * A {@link ColorStack} may be created from an existing
029 * {@link ColorProcessor} instance whose pixels are assumed to be in sRGB
030 * color space.
031 */
032public class ColorStack extends PixelPack {
033        
034        public enum ColorStackType {
035                sRGB("sR", "sG", "sB"),
036                LinearRGB("R", "G", "B"), 
037                Lab("L", "a", "b"), 
038                Luv("L", "u", "v"),
039//              XYZ("X", "Y", "Z"),             // TODO: to be implemented
040//              YCbCr("Y", "Cb", "Cr"),         // TODO: to be implemented
041                ;
042
043                protected final String[] componentLabels;
044
045                ColorStackType(String... labels) {
046                        this.componentLabels = labels;
047                }
048        }
049        
050        private ColorStackType colorspace;
051        
052        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * Constructor.
056         * @param cp a color image assumed to be in sRGB
057         */
058        public ColorStack(ColorProcessor cp) {
059                super(cp, 1.0/255, null);
060                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.sRGB);
061        }
062        
063        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        public FloatProcessor[] getProcessors() {
066                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[3];
067                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
068                        processors[k] = new FloatProcessor(width, height, data[k]);
069                }
070                return processors;
071        }
072        
073        public ColorStackType getColorspace() {
074                return this.colorspace;
075        }
076        
077        private void setColorSpace(ColorStackType newtype) {
078                this.colorspace = newtype;
079        }
080
081        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
082        
083        public void convertToLab() {
084                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.Lab) {
085                        return; // nothing to do
086                }
087                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.sRGB) {
088                        sRgbToLab();
089                }
090                else {
091                        throw new IllegalStateException("cannot convert ColorStack to LAB from " + this.colorspace);
092                }
093        }
094        
095        private void sRgbToLab() {
096                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.sRGB) {
097                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type sRGB");
098                }
099
100                final ColorSpace lcs = LabColorSpace.getInstance();
101                final float[] SRGB = new float[3];
102                
103                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
104                        getPix(i, SRGB);
105                        clipTo01(SRGB);
106                        float[] lab = lcs.fromRGB(SRGB);
107                        setPix(i, lab);
108                }
109                
110                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.Lab);
111        }
112        
113        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
114        
115        public void convertToLuv() {
116                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.Luv) {
117                        return; // nothing to do
118                }
119                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.sRGB) {
120                        sRgbToLuv();
121                }
122                else {
123                        throw new IllegalStateException("cannot convert ColorStack to LUV from " + this.colorspace);
124                }
125        }
126        
127        private void sRgbToLuv() {
128                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.sRGB) {
129                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type sRGB");
130                }
131                                
132                final LuvColorSpace lcs = LuvColorSpace.getInstance();
133                final float[] SRGB = new float[3];
134                
135                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
136                        getPix(i, SRGB);
137                        float[] luv = lcs.fromRGB(SRGB);
138                        setPix(i, luv);
139                }
140                
141                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.Luv);
142        }
143        
144        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
145        
146        public void convertToLinearRgb() {
147                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.LinearRGB) {
148                        return; // nothing to do
149                }
150                if (this.colorspace == ColorStackType.sRGB) {
151                        sRgbToLinearRgb();
152                }
153                else {
154                        throw new IllegalStateException("cannot convert ColorStack to LinearRGB from " + this.colorspace);
155                }
156        }
157        
158        private void sRgbToLinearRgb() {
159                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.sRGB) {
160                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type sRGB");
161                }
162
163                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
164                        for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
165                                data[k][i] = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaInv(clipTo01(data[k][i]));
166                        }
167                }
168
169                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.LinearRGB);
170        }
171        
172        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
173        
174        public void convertToSrgb() {
175                 switch (this.colorspace) {
176                        case Lab :      this.labToSrgb(); break;
177                        case Luv:       this.luvToSrgb(); break;
178                        case LinearRGB:         this.LinearRgbToSrgb(); break;
179                        case sRGB:      break;  // already in sRGB, nothing to do
180                        default: throw new IllegalStateException("unknown color space: " + this.colorspace);
181                 }
182        }
183        
184        private void labToSrgb() {
185                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.Lab) {
186                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type Lab");
187                }
188                final LabColorSpace lcs = LabColorSpace.getInstance();
189                final float[] LAB = new float[3];
190                
191                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
192                        getPix(i, LAB);
193                        float[] srgb = lcs.toRGB(LAB);
194                        setPix(i, srgb);
195                }
196
197                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.sRGB);
198        }
199        
200        private void luvToSrgb() {
201                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.Luv) {
202                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type Luv");
203                }
204                final ColorSpace lcs = LuvColorSpace.getInstance();
205                
206                final float[] LUV = new float[3];
207                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
208                        getPix(i, LUV);
209                        final float[] srgb = lcs.toRGB(LUV);
210                        setPix(i, srgb);
211                }
212
213                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.sRGB);
214        }
215        
216        private void LinearRgbToSrgb() {
217                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.LinearRGB) {
218                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is not of type RGB");
219                }
220
221                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
222                        for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
223                                data[k][i] = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(clipTo01(data[k][i]));
224                        }
225                }
226
227                setColorSpace(ColorStackType.sRGB);
228        }
229        
230        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
231        
232        @Override
233        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
234                if (this.colorspace != ColorStackType.sRGB) {
235                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be of type sRGB to comvert to ColorProcessor");
236                }
237                return super.toColorProcessor(255);
238        }
239        
240        @Override       // arbitrary scaling is inhibited
241        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
242                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
243        }
244        
245        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
246        
247        private float clipTo01(float val) {
248                if (val < 0) return 0f;
249                if (val > 1) return 1f;
250                return val;
251        }
252        
253        private void clipTo01(float[] vals) {
254                for (int i = 0; i < vals.length; i++) {
255                        vals[i] = clipTo01(vals[i]);
256                }
257        }
258    
259}
